articles.title: Global Insured Catastrophe Losses Hit $80 Billion in First Half of 2025
articles.description: Swiss Re Institute reports that global insured losses from natural catastrophes reached $80 billion in the first half of 2025, nearly doubling the 10-year average, driven by wildfires in California and severe thunderstorms in the United States.

articles.title: Meta Settles Defamation Suit with Robby Starbuck, Pledges to Address AI Bias
articles.description: Meta Platforms has settled a defamation lawsuit with conservative activist Robby Starbuck, who alleged that Meta’s AI falsely linked him to the Jan. 6 Capitol riots. Both parties announced a collaboration to reduce ideological and political bias in Meta’s AI systems.

articles.title: Trump’s Tariffs Come Into Force
articles.description: The United States began imposing tariffs of 10% or higher on goods from more than 60 countries and the European Union, leading to economic fallout with growth and job gains slowing and inflation ticking upward.
